Get Promoter Regions with Optional Filtering for Protein-Coding Genes Extracts promoter regions (±2kb default) from a TxDb object, optionally restricting to protein-coding genes and retaining only primary chromosomes (using a robust internal filter). Gene symbols and types are added using an AnnotationDbi object.

Source: R/utils.R
get_promoters.Rd

Get Promoter Regions with Optional Filtering for Protein-Coding Genes Extracts promoter regions (±2kb default) from a TxDb object, optionally restricting to protein-coding genes and retaining only primary chromosomes (using a robust internal filter). Gene symbols and types are added using an AnnotationDbi object.

Usage

get_promoters(
  txdb,
  annot_dbi,
  keep_mito = FALSE,
  protein_coding_only = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

txdb

A TxDb object (e.g., from GenomicFeatures::makeTxDbFromGFF() or a prebuilt TxDb package).

annot_dbi

An AnnotationDbi object (e.g., org.Hs.eg.db, org.Mm.eg.db) for mapping gene IDs to symbols and types.

keep_mito

Logical; whether to keep mitochondrial chromosome (default = FALSE).

protein_coding_only

Logical; whether to restrict to protein-coding genes (default = TRUE).

verbose

Logical; print informative messages (default = TRUE).

Value

A GRanges object of promoter regions, annotated with gene symbols, optionally filtered to protein-coding genes.
